TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SelectionRangeConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> class represents a single date or a range of dates. This class is commonly associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control, where it represents the selected and highlighted dates. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter> class is an adjunct class to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> that enables you to convert to and from other types, most often strings.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class, [Generalized Type Conversion](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/49253ae6-7657-4810-82ab-1176a6feeada), and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

Docs.related: How to: Implement a Type Converter

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.%23ctor%2A> is the default constructor supplied by the compiler.
You should never create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type sourceType);

Public Overrides Function CanConvertFrom (context As ITypeDescriptorContext, sourceType As Type) As Boolean

override this.CanConvertFrom : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * Type -> bool

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Determines if this converter can convert an object of the specified source type to the native type of the converter by querying the supplied type descriptor context.
Docs.returns: if the converter can perform the specified conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter> class is specialized to convert between the types <xref:System.String> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange>. As a result, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> method returns `true` if the `sourceType` parameter is of type <xref:System.String>. Otherwise, it defers the call to the base implementation of this method, <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%28System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext%2CSystem.Type%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

block.para:
Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.
The parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. The parameter may be , so you should always verify the information. Also, properties on the context object may also return .

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type destinationType);

Public Overrides Function CanConvertTo (context As ITypeDescriptorContext, destinationType As Type) As Boolean

override this.CanConvertTo : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * Type -> bool

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the specified destination type by using the specified context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the specified conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CanConvertTo%2A> method returns `true` if the `destinationType` parameter is of type <xref:System.String> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor>. Otherwise, it defers the call to the base implementation of this method, <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertTo%28System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext%2CSystem.Type%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

block.para:

override this.ConvertFrom : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * System.Globalization.CultureInfo * obj -> obj

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
The locale information for the conversion.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified value to the converter's native type by using the specified locale.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method is specialized to convert <xref:System.String> values that represent a range of dates to their <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> representations. Types other than <xref:System.String> are passed to the base class implementation of this method.

Docs.exception: is of type but could not be parsed into two strings representing dates.
is of type that was parsed into two strings, but the conversion of one or both into the type did not succeed.

block.para:
Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method is specialized to convert <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> values to their <xref:System.String> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> representations. Other types are passed to the base class implementation of this method.

override this.CreateInstance : System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext * System.Collections.IDictionary -> obj

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
An that contains the new property values.
Docs.summary: Creates a object by using the specified type descriptor and set of property values for that object.
Docs.returns: If successful, the newly created ; otherwise, this method throws an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CreateInstance%2A> method to make changes to an existing immutable object by creating a modified version of it. This method expects the `propertyValues` parameter to have elements with key values of `Start` and `End`, each with the corresponding <xref:System.DateTime> value.

Docs.exception: is or its Start and End elements could not be converted into a .
